H0.text: what territory is spain and the united kingdom in a dispute over. Falkland Islands

H2.text: what territory is spain and the united kingdom in a dispute over. Rockall

H3.text: what territory is spain and the united kingdom in a dispute over. Gibraltar

A4.text: Ireland claims that UK rights to Rockall are invalid.

A5.text: Denmark (on behalf of the Faroes) and Iceland have lodged claims of the adjoining seabed.

A6.text: The status of Gibraltar is a major point of contention in relations between the two nations, dating back to the conflicts in the early 18th century.

A7.text: In two referendums, held in September 1967 and November 2002, the people of Gibraltar rejected any proposal for the transfer of sovereignty to Spain.
